At one 	stage, during this heated 	debate, Churchill telegraphed to 	the War Cabinet: 	“I hope 	the Cabinet will 	stand firm 	and not be disturbed 	by the 	attitude of 	the Viceroy. 	He thinks 	that because 	Gandhi wrote a 	letter to 	him, he 	is entitled to 	reply in 	terms which 	do not 	commend themselves to 	the War Cabinet. 	As a matter 	of fact, 	he has 	no right 	to negotiate 	with Gandhi 	at all, 	considering he 	was responsible 	for passing 	to us 	the medical opinion on 	which we 	were told that he 	would never be 	able to 	take part 	in politics 	again.
